title: Leeds Country Way Walking Route

images.title: RichTea [CC BY-SA (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0)]
images.caption: Saw Wood, Leeds Country Way. This is the entrance to Saw Wood from the north, on the Leeds Country Way, a 60 mile footpath which encircles Leeds.

images.title: Mick Melvin / Leeds Country Way Marker
images.caption: A handsome carved stone marker on the Leeds Country Way close to Cheesecake Farm

images.title: RichTea [CC BY-SA (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0)]
images.caption: Stile on the trail. Here it follows Pudsey Beck, which is out of the picture to the right.

images.title: Lis Burke [CC BY-SA (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0)]
images.caption: Looking east across fields towards Garforth from an old track which now forms part of the trail

images.title: Chris Heaton / Leeds Country Way at Bankhouse Bottom
images.caption: Bankhouse Bottom. Following the long distance footpath north westwards toward Black Carr Woods.

images.title: RichTea [CC BY-SA (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0)]
images.caption: Hunger Hills, Horsforth. The sign marks the Leeds Country Way as it skirts the western edge of Horsforth

images.title: Chris Heaton / Leeds Country Way near East Keswick
images.caption: Near East Keswick The long distance footpath about a mile west of Bardsey. It is closer to East Keswick at this point, but does not actually visit this village.

description: A super circular walk through the countryside surrounding this major Yorkshire city. The walk has been split into 4 manageable sections: Golden Acre Park to Barwick-in-Elmet Barwick-in-Elmet to Carlton Carlton to Cockersdale Cockersdale to Golden Acre Park. Highlights on the route include
